unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) networks across India, aiming to connect millions of homes to high-speed internet. JioFiber recently announced the completion of 100,000 km of fiber optic cable laying in Rajasthan, focusing on connecting tier-2 and tier-3 cities.
normalised: New Delhi, India – Reliance J I O and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) networks across India, aiming to connect millions of homes to high-speed internet. JioFiber recently announced the completion of one hundred thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable laying in Rajasthan, focusing on connecting tier two and tier three cities.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Airtel Xstream Fiber is making significant inroads in the southern states, particularly in Tamil Nadu and Karnataka, offering competitive plans starting at Rs. 499. Both companies are leveraging the government's BharatNet project to accelerate their rollout.
normalised: Meanwhile, Airtel Xstream Fiber is making significant inroads in the southern states, particularly in Tamil Nadu and Karnataka, offering competitive plans starting at rupee four hundred and ninety nine. Both companies are leveraging the government's BharatNet project to accelerate their rollout.

unnormalised: Analysts at ICICI Securities predict a 30% year-on-year growth in FTTH subscriptions, driven by increased demand for online entertainment and remote work, mirroring the digital transformation showcased in films like "3 Idiots," where technology plays a crucial role in connecting people and bridging the digital divide. IIT Madras is partnering with local ISPs to develop cost-effective FTTH solutions tailored for rural communities. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the FTTH expansion to ensure fair competition and consumer protection.
normalised: Analysts at I C I C I Securities predict a thirty percent year-on-year growth in F T T H subscriptions, driven by increased demand for online entertainment and remote work, mirroring the digital transformation showcased in films like "three Idiots," where technology plays a crucial role in connecting people and bridging the digital divide. I I T Madras is partnering with local I S Ps to develop cost-effective F T T H solutions tailored for rural communities. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is closely monitoring the F T T H expansion to ensure fair competition and consumer protection.
